disclaimerData.disclaimer:
Procedure Description:

Lip blush is a semi-permanent cosmetic tattooing technique that subtly enhances the lips' natural color, shape, and definition. The process involves implanting custom-blended pigment into the lips using a fine needle, creating a soft, tinted effect. Results can last between 1 and 3 years, depending on individual skin type, lifestyle habits, and adherence to aftercare instructions.

Advantages of Lip Blush:
Color Enhancement: Adds a subtle, natural-looking tint, ideal for individuals with pale or uneven lip color.
Definition Improvement: Refines the lip border, creating a more symmetrical and fuller appearance.
Longevity: Results are durable, typically lasting 1 to 3 years before fading gradually.
Convenience: Reduces the need for daily lipstick application, offering a low-maintenance alternative.
Minimally Invasive: A non-surgical procedure with no significant recovery period required.

Potential Risks and Complications:
While lip blush is generally safe, potential risks and complications include:
Allergic Reaction: Possible sensitivity to the pigment or topical anesthetics used, which may present as redness, swelling, itching, or rash.
Infection: Risk of infection if aftercare protocols are not properly followed.
Swelling and Bruising: Temporary swelling and bruising are common immediately post-procedure, usually resolving within a few days.
Uneven Pigmentation: Pigment may occasionally heal unevenly, necessitating a follow-up touch-up session.
Hyperpigmentation or Hypopigmentation: Rarely, the treated area may become darker (hyperpigmentation) or lighter (hypopigmentation) than anticipated.
Scarring: Although uncommon, scarring can occur due to improper aftercare, allergic reaction, or infection.
Color Fading: Pigment will naturally fade over time; periodic touch-ups may be required to maintain the desired color.
Herpes Simplex Outbreak: For individuals with a history of cold sores, the procedure may trigger an outbreak. Prophylactic antiviral medication is often recommended.

Common Side Effects:
Redness and Swelling: Mild redness and swelling are expected immediately after the procedure, typically subsiding within hours to a few days.
Tenderness: Lips may feel tender or sore for a few days following the treatment.
Dryness and Flaking: As part of the healing process, lips may become dry and peel or flake, which is normal.
Itching: Mild itching may occur during healing; avoid scratching or picking to prevent complications.
Healing Timeline: Complete healing takes approximately 7-10 days. During this time, lips may appear darker before the final color settles.

Contraindications:
You should not undergo lip blush if you:
Are pregnant or currently breastfeeding.
Have active cold sores or herpes simplex lesions on or near the lips.
Have a history of keloid or hypertrophic scarring.
Have known allergies to any pigments, anesthetics, or topical products used.
Are undergoing chemotherapy or have an autoimmune disorder (consult your physician first).
Have severe, untreated skin conditions (such as eczema, psoriasis, or dermatitis) affecting the lip area.
Are taking anticoagulant medications or have a bleeding disorder.

Pre-Treatment Instructions:
Avoid Sun Exposure: Minimize sun exposure for at least 48 hours before your appointment to reduce skin sensitivity.
No Alcohol: Refrain from alcohol consumption for 24 hours prior to the procedure to decrease the risk of excessive swelling and bruising.
Limit Caffeine: Avoid caffeine on the day of your appointment, as it can heighten sensitivity and swelling.
No Lip Products: Do not apply lipstick, gloss, or balm on the day of the procedure.
Cold Sore Prevention: If you have a history of cold sores, inform your practitioner. You may be advised to take antiviral medication beforehand.

I confirm that I have been informed about all relevant aspects of this treatment and that I fully comprehend this advice. This includes information regarding:
- The reasons for undergoing the procedure and the desired results
- The inherent risks of the procedure itself
- The risks associated with declining the procedure
- Any risks specific to my personal health
- The anticipated benefits of the treatment
- Potential drawbacks or disadvantages
- Alternative treatments and their advantages and disadvantages, including the choice to have no treatment
- Any uncertainties and the probability of a successful outcome
- Any follow-up care that might be necessary

MEDICAL IMAGERY: I authorize the taking of clinical photographs and videos. I understand these will become part of my confidential medical records.

I have been asked what information I require to make an informed decision and have had the opportunity to discuss my goals in detail.

I certify that I have read this consent, understand it fully, have had ample opportunity for discussion, and all my questions have been answered to my satisfaction. No new information has come to light that affects my decision to undergo treatment or provide consent. I hereby consent to this procedure. This document constitutes the complete disclosure and supersedes any prior verbal or written information.

All deposits and booking fees are non-refundable unless otherwise agreed with the practitioner.

questions.content: Do you comprehend the details that have been given to you?
Do you believe enough information has been shared to allow you to give informed consent?
Have you given your consent voluntarily?
Are there any health issues you currently have?
Are you currently pregnant or nursing a child?
Do you suffer from a neuromuscular disorder (such as Multiple Sclerosis, ALS, motor neuropathy, myasthenia gravis, or Lambert-Eaton syndrome)?
Do you have an autoimmune condition?
Do you experience any skin problems?
Do you have any known allergies or a history of severe allergic reactions (anaphylaxis)?
Is there an active infection at the area where the procedure is planned?
Are you currently on any antibiotics or other prescribed medications?
Is there any other Medical or Social History we should be aware of? If yes, please explain in detail.
What are your goals and desired results for undergoing this procedure? Please elaborate.
Have you undergone this or a comparable treatment previously? If so, were there any issues? Please provide details.
Do you have any concerns? If so, please describe them.
Is there anything else we need to know? Please provide full information.
I will keep this information for the duration of my treatment and consult it as needed.
